intro: Tillandsia acosta-solisii, commonly known as the Acosta-Solis tillandsia, is a species of air plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that trap moisture and nutrients from the air. The plant typically grows in rocky or shaded environments, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
